name: St. Melania the Younger
summary: Melania the Younger was a Roman noblewoman and the granddaughter of Melania the Elder. She and her husband Pinianus gave away their vast wealth and traveled to the Holy Land, where they founded monasteries. She was a friend of St. Jerome and other Church Fathers. Her life is documented in a biography by Gerontius, which provides valuable insight into the lives of wealthy Christian women in the 4th and 5th centuries.
